First, we need to understand what the title "Romeo and Juliet" refers to. It is a famous play written by William Shakespeare that tells the story of two young lovers from feuding families who tragically die in the end. 

Next, we need to consider whether this play is appropriate for high school students to study. While the themes of love, loyalty, and tragedy are universal, the play also contains mature themes such as violence, death, and sex. However, many high school curriculums include Romeo and Juliet as required reading for students. 

So, the answer to the question is "no", it is not an unusual title to teach high schoolers. In fact, it is a classic piece of literature that has been studied by students for centuries. The play can help students to develop their critical thinking, analysis, and writing skills while also exposing them to the world of Shakespearean language and drama.

Firstly, Romeo and Juliet is a classic play written by William Shakespeare, and it is considered one of the most famous and influential works of literature in the English language. It deals with timeless themes such as love, hatred, fate, and tragedy, and has been adapted into many different forms of media, including films, operas, and musicals. 
Therefore, it is a valuable piece of art that has stood the test of time and has been studied and analyzed by scholars and readers for centuries. 
Moreover, high school students are mature enough to understand and appreciate the complexities and nuances of the play, and it can help them to develop critical thinking, analytical, and communication skills. 
In conclusion, Romeo and Juliet is not an unusual title to teach high schoolers, but rather a thought-provoking and enlightening one.
